Yes, the University of Hong Kong has several programs and initiatives in place to promote student well-being on campus. Some of these programs are:

1. Student Counselling and Development Centre (SCDC): The SCDC provides psychological counseling and support to students who may be experiencing stress, anxiety, or other emotional or mental health issues.

2. University Health Service (UHS): UHS provides medical services, including general health check-ups, immunizations, and health consultations.

3. Career-focused support: The University offers career development programs and services through its Career Hub, which offers career counseling, job search resources, and skill-building workshops and seminars.

4. Housing and Residential Life: The University provides safe, comfortable, and affordable student housing options that promote a sense of community and belonging.

5. Physical Fitness and wellness: The University offers a wide range of sports and fitness facilities that promote physical health and well-being. Student organizations such as the HKU Fitness and Wellness Club also encourage healthy living and wellness activities.

Additionally, the University conducts several workshops and seminars on well-being, stress management, time management, and other topics aimed at promoting the overall well-being of students.
